data.title: 16 of Jeremih’s Best Hip
data.meta_description: In efforts to shine light on Jeremih's incredible talent, we've compiled a list of his best collaborations. Check it out.
data.text:
For the past few years, Jeremih has been hip-hop's secret weapon, spawning a repeated mass of worldwide hits. For some reason or another, it seems that the Chicago bred hook master has yet to receive his just due.

Over the years, kicking off in 2009, Jeremih has assisted in crafting some of the last decade's hottest records but has slightly struggled when it comes to achieving mass attention as a solo act. No one can pin point the exact reasoning, but one thing is certain and that is the singer will soon has his moment, as he belts out on the famed DJ Drama-Meek Mill and 2 Chainz assisted record, "My Moment."

Recently releasing his third studio album, Late Nights, which unveiled "Planes" featuring J. Cole, it seems Jeremih is attempting at reaching a new levels of recognition with the project. Not to mention the success of "Don't Tell Em'" with YG and the remix, released in 2014. He's constantly churning out new collaborations too, releasing “Pass Dat” Remix featuring Chance The Rapper,Young Thug and The Weeknd just the other day. In July, Jeremih dropped his Late Nights:Europe mixtape. The project has guest contributions from Wiz Khalifa, Ty Dolla $ign, The Game and more.

In efforts to shine light on Jeremih's incredible talent, we've compiled a list of his best collaborations. Check it out.
